item.title: PlayStation Store Launches Dealmania Sale
item.description:
Summary

  • The PlayStation Store Dealmania Sale offers up to 90% off on over 2,000 games for PS4 and PS5.
  • The sale ends on March 13 at 2:59 a.m. ET.
  • Titles like Marvel's Spider-Man Remastered, Death Stranding: Director's Cut, and Persona 3 Reload are heavily discounted during the sale.

Sony launched its massive Dealmania Sale in the PlayStation Store with discounts on over 2,000 games and DLC for PlayStation 4 and PlayStation 5. For a limited time, PlayStation fans can score major savings on critically acclaimed PS4 and PS5 games like Sonic X Shadow Generations , Like a Dragon Gaiden: The Man Who Erased His Name , Death Stranding , and much more.

Sony regularly hosts sales in its PlayStation Store throughout the year to give gamers a chance to pick up games they've missed out on at a great price. The PlayStation Store's Extended Play Sale is still ongoing until March 6 with a focus on DLC and bundles, but Sony has decided to launch one of its biggest sales yet in the form of the Dealmania Sale.

The Dealmania Sale brings discounts of up to 90% off on exactly 2,496 items for PS4 and PS5 on the PlayStation Store until March 13 at 2:59 a.m. ET. Various game bundles for PS5 are discounted by 50%, including EA Sports College Football Deluxe Edition and EA Sports FC 25 Ultimate Edition for $39.99 each. Many of Sony's first-party games received major discounts as well, including Marvel's Spider-Man Remastered for $24.99 and The Last of Us Part II Remastered for $39.99. Moreover, the Dealmania Sale brings discounts on some of 2024's best games, including Sonic X Shadow Generations for $37.49, Persona 3 Reload for $34.99, Tekken 8 Deluxe Edition for $69.99, and Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance for $35.99, to name a few.

PlayStation Store Dealmania Sale Highlights

  • The Dealmania Sale ends on March 13 at 2:59 a.m. ET
    • EA Sports College Football Deluxe Edition and EA Sports FC 25 Ultimate Edition for $39.99 each
    • Marvel's Spider-Man Remastered for $24.99
    • The Last of Us Part II Remastered for $39.99
    • Sonic X Shadow Generations for $37.49
    • Persona 3 Reload for $34.99
    • Tekken 8 Deluxe Edition for $69.99
    • Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance for $35.99
    • Like a Dragon Gaiden: The Man Who Erased His Name Premium Edition for $21.99
    • Death Stranding: Director's Cut for $19.99
    • The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt (PS5) for $7.99

PS4 and PS5 gamers also have the opportunity to fill out their libraries with some of the most revered games of recent years. For example, Death Stranding: Director's Cut is available for just $19.99, and the upgraded PS5 version of The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt is available for $7.99. Other celebrated titles like A Way Out , Bayonetta , Lost Judgment , and Persona 4 Golden can be found at some of their lowest all-time prices yet in the PlayStation Store. Similarly to Lost Judgment , Ryu Ga Gotoku Studio's many Yakuza/Like a Dragon titles are also heavily discounted, allowing newer fans to catch up to the recently released Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii . One of the discounted titles from the studio is Like a Dragon Gaiden: The Man Who Erased His Name , which can be bought for as low as $21.99 with the Premium Edition.

The Dealmania Sale comes at an opportune time for some PlayStation fans, as Sony is sending $10 in PlayStation Store credit to select users. The credit is being sent out as compensation to users shopping in the PlayStation Store on December 24, 2024. At that time, the PlayStation Store experienced technical issues heading into Christmas, which typically turns out to be one of the busiest days of the year for the digital storefront.

item.title: Pokemon Scarlet & Violet: How to Get Toedscruel (How to Evolve Toedscool into Toedscruel)
item.description:
Ground/Grass-type Toedscool and Toedscruel are likely to be mistaken for regional variants of Tentacool and Tentacruel. However, like Wiglett and Wugtrio, they are an entirely different species. With returning and new Grass and Ground-type Pokemon in Scarlet & Violet , you may be wondering if Toedscruel is a good Pokemon to use in battle or raids. Toedscool and Toedscruel aren't rare in Scarlet & Violet , so you'll have plenty of time to decide whether to keep them in the party.

Where to Find Toedscool in Pokemon Scarlet & Violet

Toedscool Location

Toedscool can be found in the South, East, and West Provinces hanging around tree trunks in their respective habitats. Because they're such common Pokemon, you'll want to narrow your search to make finding them easier. You should look for Toedscool in the following locations:

  • Watchtower in East Province (Area Two), near Levincia.
  • The area outside Medali.
  • Socarrat Trail.

Refer to the objective flag on the images below for Toedscool spawn locations:

If you want Toedscool somewhat early in your playthrough, you should search for them in East Province (Area Two). They're also ideal for Levincia's gym battle, which specializes in Electric-type Pokemon. You should take a Flying Taxi to the watch tower on the hill near Levincia's southern exit.

If you're near Medali, you'll find a variety of Pokemon roaming about the area outside the city. Among these are Toedscool, and they're at a higher level than their East Province-counterparts. The Toedscool in this area are above their evolution level, so you can simply level them up one more time to trigger the evolution.

Finally, Socarrat Trail, which is north of Casseroya Lake, is full of Bug and Grass-types. However, at this point in your playthrough, you may already have a Grass-type on your team.

In short:

  • Toedscools in East Province (Area Two) near the watchtower outside Levincia are around level 19 .
  • Toedscools near Medali are around level 34 .
  • Toedscool on Socarrat Trail are the highest-level Toedscools you'll find in Paldea, being around level 54 .

You can also get Toedscool from 1-star Tera Raids. These will be available as soon as you begin your Treasure Hunt. Pokemon caught from 1-star Tera Raids will be level 12 , and their Tera Typing may not match their base Typing. Meaning you could end up with a Toedscool that has an Electric Tera Type instead of Ground or Grass.

How to Evolve Toedscool into Toedscruel

Where to Find Toedscruel

If you want Toedscruel, you'll need to evolve Toedscool. Toedscool evolves into Toedscruel at level 30 . As mentioned earlier, you may already have a Toedscool that's above its evolution level if you caught one near Medali or Socarrat Trail. Level it up once via Rare Candy or Exp. Candy to make it a Toedscruel.

Toedscruel Locations (Paldea and Kitakami)

You can also catch Toedscruel in the wild . Unlike Toedscool, Toedscruel only appears in one area in Paldea , and that's Socarrat Trail . You'll find Toedscruel surrounded by Toedscools.

If you bought the Expansion Pass, then you can look for Toedscruels in Kitakami:

  • There's a fixed spawn Toedscruel in the Kitakami Wilds that's level 36 . If you've completed "The Way Home" main quest, then it will instead be level 69 .
  • The other fixed spawn Toedscruel is in the Timeless Woods . This one's level is 52 , or 73 if you completed "The Way Home."

Like Toedscool, Toedscruel can be found in Tera Raids. They only appear in 4-star and 6-star Tera Raids. 4-star Tera Raids unlock when you have 7 gym badges; 6-star Tera Raids appear when you've completed the Academy Ace Tournament in the post-game.

Toedscruel Weaknesses and Stats

Is Toedscruel Worth Using?

Toedscruel being a Ground/Grass-type means it has some more type coverage that regular Grass and Ground-type don't have. However, it also gains more weaknesses. Its dual-typing makes it extremely weak to Ice-type moves, so you'll want to keep it away from those as much as you can.

Here are Toedscruel's weaknesses/type-effectiveness as well as stats:

Super-effective against:

Electric, Fire, Poison, Steel, Water, Ground, Rock,

Weaknesses:

Ice (4x), Fire, Flying, Bug

Resistances:

Rock, Ground

Immunities:

Electric

HP:

80

Attack:

70

Special Attack:

80

Defense:

65

Special Defense:

120

Speed:

100

Total:

515

Toedscruel doesn't have a very high Attack or Special Attack base stat. However, if you want to use it offensively, you should give it special moves such as Sludge Bomb or Energy Ball. On the plus side, Toedscruel has great Special Defense and Speed, essentially making it a speedy, special wall. Therefore, if you want a Pokemon that has high Special Defense and Speed with only four type weaknesses, then you may want to consider Toedscruel.

Toedscruel only has one Ability, and that's Mycelium Might. This allows a user's status move to hit the target regardless of the target's own Ability (ex: Big Pecks). On the downside, if Toedscruel uses a status move, it will always move after the opponent.

item.title: Hello Kitty Island Adventure: How to Get Spark
item.description:
To obtain some of the more common materials for repairing things around the island, you'll need to craft them from materials. Hello Kitty Island Adventure has a cast of colorful characters that you can befriend via gift-giving and quest completion. When given a gift they like, characters will provide you with a unique resource/material that you can't find elsewhere. One of these is the Spark material, and it's used in a variety of Island Adventure 's crafting plans, so you'll want to start collecting them as soon as possible.

How to Get Light Stones

How to Unlock Spark Crafting Plans

In order to make Spark , you're going to need the Spark crafting plans . You'll receive them during the quest "A Zipline Adventure". To unlock this quest, you'll need to be at level 4 friendship with Pochacco . The Spark crafting plans require x3 Light Stones to make x1 Spark .

The only way to get Light Stones is to give gifts to Kuromi . The amount she gives you is determined by the quality of the gift and your friendship level with her. Here are some recommended gifts for Kuromi:

Gift Name

Gift Rating

How to Get/Craft

Crafting Plans Location

Jack-o-Lantern

2-hearts

  • x5 Pumpkins

  • Open the chest on the lily pad near the Potion Hut in Spooky Swamp.

Pumpkin

1-heart

  • Grab them from the pumpkin patch in Spooky Swamp.

  • N/A

Spicy Pumpkin Latte

2-heart

  • Use the Espresso Machine at the Comedy Club in Rainbow Reef.
  • Ingredients:
    • x1 Candelnut
    • x1 Pumpkin
    • x1 Cinnabloom

  • Station Upgrade: Requires level 4 friendship with Hangyodon.
  • Make a Spicy Pumpkin Latte for the first time, and it will unlock its crafting plans.

Pumpkin Spice Soda

3-heart

  • Use the Soda Machine on Gemstone Mountain.
  • Ingredients:
    • x1 Fizzy Crystal
    • x1 Pumpkin
    • x1 Cinnabloom

  • Station Upgrade: Requires level 6 friendship with Pekkle.
  • Make a Pumpkin Spice Soda for the first time, and it will unlock its crafting plans.

Where to Use Spark

Every Crafting Plan with Spark

Once you have Spark, you can repair the ziplines and make higher-quality gifts, such as the Computer. As you unlock more of the Story Quests, you may have to repair various attractions and machines around the island. Some of these will require Spark, so you should make it a habit of farming Light Stones every day.

Spark is a required resource for three of the 3-heart gifts in Island Adventure . You'll need Spark for the Volcanic Guitar , Interactive History of Chocolate , and The Greatest Challenge . These are for Retsuko, Chococat, and Big Challenges respectively.

Here's every crafting plan that uses Spark:

Name

Required Materials

Computer

  • x2 Spark
  • x2 Mechanism
  • x1 Glitch

Volcanic Guitar

  • x2 Spark
  • x2 Ingot
  • x1 Mechanism

Interactive History of Chocolate

  • x1 Spark
  • x1 Blank Book
  • x1 Mechanism
  • x3 Chocolate Coin

The Greatest Challenge

  • x2 Spark
  • x2 Little Challenge
  • x2 Ingot

Snorkel

  • x2 Spark
  • x2 Ingot
  • x10 Rubber

Rain Island Stone

  • x5 Spark
  • x50 Chocolate Coin
  • x100 Seashell

Star Island Stone

  • x5 Spark
  • x50 Stardust
  • x100 Candy Cloud

Crafting Table

  • x10 Spark
  • x10 Ingot
  • x10 Woodblock
  • x100 Gizmo

Espresso Machine

  • x5 Spark
  • x10 Mechanism
  • x100 Candelnut

Dessert Machine

  • x5 Spark
  • x10 Mechanism
  • x100 Cactus Cream

Candy Cloud Machine

  • x5 Spark
  • x5 Star
  • x100 Candy Cloud

Furniture Customizer

  • x5 Spark
  • x10 Ingot
  • x10 Woodblock
  • x100 Wool

Pizza Oven

  • x5 Spark
  • x10 Ingot
  • x100 Dough

Egg Pan Station

  • x5 Spark
  • x10 Ingot
  • x100 Egg

Soda Machine

  • x5 Spark
  • x10 Ingot
  • x100 Fizzy Crystal

Cauldron

  • x5 Spark
  • x10 Ingot
  • x100 Glow Berry

Oven

  • x5 Spark
  • x10 Mechanism
  • x100 Flour

Yummy Wallpaper

  • x5 Spark
  • x50 Mushroom
  • x50 Pumpkin

Cottage Lamp

  • x15 Spark
  • x5 Wool

Music Disc Player

  • x3 Spark
  • x3 Woodblock

Tropical Hologram

  • x1 Spark
  • x1 Glitch
  • x5 Sand Dollar

Swampy Hologram

  • x1 Spark
  • x1 Glitch
  • x5 Mushroom

Rocky Hologram

  • x1 Spark
  • x1 Glitch
  • x5 Shiny

Aquatic Hologram

  • x1 Spark
  • x1 Glitch
  • x5 Seashell

Volcanic Hologram

  • x1 Spark
  • x1 Glitch
  • x5 Obsidian Shard

Dreamy Hologram

  • x1 Spark
  • x1 Glitch
  • x1 Star

item.title: Accidental Win - Help From Above!
item.description: A monster helps a player in Elden Ring and more accidental wins.

item.title: The Case for The Elder Scrolls 6 to Introduce Firearms After Avowed
item.description:
When discussing western fantasy RPGs, it's practically impossible for there to not be at least one small mention of Bethesda's Elder Scrolls series. The Elder Scrolls franchise has been at the forefront of the fantasy gaming genre for over three decades, and despite its last mainline entry now being almost 14-years-old, it's still as popular as ever. And with The Elder Scrolls still being a mainstay of the genre, it's only natural for newcomers like Avowed to be compared to Bethesda's back-catalog.

An open-zone fantasy RPG, Avowed feels somewhat like an evolution of the core Elder Scrolls formula. More specifically, Avowed sometimes feels like a bit of a spiritual successor to Skyrim . Even if Avowed isn't generally considered to be an overall better experience than some of Bethesda's RPGs, it's undeniable that it's brought some worthwhile improvements and additions to the fantasy RPG table, such as its great weapon variety. And though The Elder Scrolls 6 should certainly chart its own course, it might want to borrow one key part of Avowed 's arsenal.

The Elder Scrolls 6 Might Want to Add Firearms After Avowed

Firearms Add Some Spice to Avowed's Fantasy Combat

Avowed is home to all the usual weaponry fans have come to expect from fantasy RPGs. From one-handed melee weapons like swords and maces, to two-handed warhammers, to ranged weapons like bows, to a more unique spin on magic weaponry with wands and grimoires, all the usual suspects are there. But Avowed is also home to a variety of firearms.

Falling into two main categories, Pistols and Arquebuses, Avowed 's firearms aren't too special on their own. Their damage output is fairly high compared to other ranged weapons, but their incredibly slow reload speed can be an irritating and abrupt break of pace during combat.

But Avowed 's firearms really shine when they're paired with a classic fantasy weapon. A sword and pistol combo lets players feel like a sort of medieval pirate, while a grimoire/wand and pistol combo makes them feel like some kind of mercenary sorcerer. Avowed 's firearms are a great way to spice up the usual loadouts fantasy RPG fans have grown accustomed to over the years, and it's a simple addition that could give The Elder Scrolls 6 's arsenal a welcome shake-up.

The Elder Scrolls 6 Might Need To Be Careful With Firearms

The existence of firearms in The Elder Scrolls universe is a bit of a divisive topic among some fans. There have been several reported references to gunpowder throughout the Elder Scrolls franchise. In Morrowind 's Tribunal expansion, players are given Dwemer satchel packs that are essentially explosive devices. In Skyrim 's Dawnguard expansion, players can find schematics for explosive crossbow bolts. And in The Elder Scrolls Online , players can set explosive traps during a quest.

But while gunpowder has popped up a few times over the years, firearms specifically have not been mentioned in any piece of canon Elder Scrolls media. The closest it's gotten is a mention of cannons in one of Daggerfall 's in-game books. But that doesn't mean firearms couldn't be a part of the Elder Scrolls universe moving forward.

While a bolt of elemental magic is obviously more powerful than a mere metal ball fired from a gun, the appearance of firearms in The Elder Scrolls 6 would be a fun way to add more variety to the game's combat. Their appearance would just need to come with a brief lore explanation.
